meanings.sent1: She showed great cohunes when she stood up to the bully.
meanings.sent2: His cohunes allowed him to face his fears and try something new.
meanings.sent3: Despite her small size, her cohunes were bigger than anyone expected.
meanings.sent4: The firefighter's cohunes shone brightly as he ran into the burning building.
meanings.sent5: The knight's cohunes were as strong as his armor, protecting him in battle.

meanings.definition: Cohunes (verb): To have the courage or bravery to do something.
meanings.sent1: He cohunes to speak up for what is right, even when it's difficult.
meanings.sent2: They cohunes to climb the mountain, despite the challenging weather.
meanings.sent3: The cat cohunes to face the vacuum cleaner, ready to pounce if needed.
meanings.sent4: She cohunes to dive into the deep end of the pool, conquering her fear of water.
meanings.sent5: The team cohunes to take on the unbeaten champions, ready for the challenge ahead.
